revised_title: Geography and Paper Money in 17th Century China
tldr: Father Anthony Gaubil, a Jesuit missionary in China, provides an account of the knowledge of geography among the Chinese and the use of paper money in the 17th century. He discusses the Chinese understanding of foreign countries, their maps, and the origins of paper currency. He also mentions the lack of Chinese knowledge about certain regions and the influence of European contact on their understanding of geography.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History
